page_content: The page provides information about open data tools, including how to filter catalogs, use web services, and apply open-source software and programming languages. It also offers guidelines for structuring open data and available data formats.

The page offers information on organizing and conducting parent education workshops and events in the Canton of Zurich. It includes details on workshops, tools, guidelines, and support for those responsible for parent education in schools, municipalities, and other organizations.
The page could not be accessed, resulting in a 404 error.

The page details the accreditation process for support measures within the integration system for refugees in the Canton of Zurich. It includes information on re-accreditation, new accreditations, and the types of accredited offers, such as education, language courses, and work integration.

The page refers to a government resolution (No. 1913/2009) regarding the MIT10 migration project, specifically related to PC clients and software, periodic renewal, tendering, issuance, approval, and authorization.

The page outlines the standards for bicycle traffic in the Canton of Zurich. It describes the process of creating new standards for safe and attractive bicycle infrastructure, including guidelines and regulations. A downloadable PDF document detailing the standards is also available.

The page provides tools and templates to assist municipalities in Zurich with budgeting and annual financial statements. It includes downloadable templates for various financial calculations, assessments, and evaluations, such as financial ratios, cash flow statements, property valuation, and tax accounting.

The page provides an overview of the information and communications technology (ICT) sector in the Canton of Zurich. It highlights the significance of ICT in various industries, the growing sector, key players, and initiatives like eZürich to promote Zurich as an ICT location. It also mentions educational programs and organizations related to ICT.

The page provides information on the coordination and annual updating of development and access status (Überbauungs- und Erschliessungsstand) in the municipalities of the Canton of Zurich. It includes details on the criteria for determining building readiness, the process for municipalities to review and update data, and access to a Webmap for online tracking.
